metadata.name: Cloak 44 #001
metadata.description:
Cloak 44 is a collection by Dominique Baker made up of 44x 1/1 NFTs created from one large woodblock relief print IRL. The physical print (measuring 2.4m x 1.2m) was first carved in to mdf wood using Yoshiharu steel chisels. The carving alone took about 40 hours to complete. The finished carving was then rolled over with black waterbased ink. Fabric made of 100% cotton was then laid on top of the ink, and with the help of Baker's husband Hamish Wight it was driven over by a heavy 2.5 tonne roadwork steel roller.

Each NFT is a close-up of the final relief print, creating a beautiful high resolution image, perfect for printing or as a large backdrop in the Metaverse.

Four NFTs from the collection have been kept as artist copies for print distribution.
